website_summaries.verdict: Customers needing a cheaper pair of Burton gloves should check out this highly-rated, affordable model.
pros: Removable wrist leash for easy carrying
cons: Palms of gloves more prone to ripping and scratching under heavy outdoor use

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, gauntlet could be longer.
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these for half a season of snowboarding and they are quite warm. I've been out in sub-freezing/windy temps, and didn't need an extra hand warmer. The only thing I'd prefer would be a longer gauntlet length - if you're a new skier/snowboarder, or just someone who tends to crash a lot, you will end up with some cold wrists if you wear these for a day. The gauntlet just isn't long enough to really cover everything. Otherwise very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Seventh-777Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Don’t wear on snowy days unless you like wet hands
customer_reviews.text: Not very waterproof, just holding my snowboard on my way to the lift with snow on my board my gloves started to get wet and I could feel some wetness on the inside. Gave it a four star and changed it to one. These gloves are complete trash... not waterproof at all... they’re good for bluebird days and if you don’t touch the snow... but if you do they’re like sponges and will take it all in and turn your hands to prunes
customer_reviews.author: Tj

customer_reviews.title: Not water proof at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves for a new season of snowboarding. I was so excited and these gloves looked really good and matched my equipment perfectly. Brought these to the first day on the mountain and was very disappointed. The inside of these gloves got soaked with water from riding with them. I took them off and squeezed them and water bubbles started to come out of the seams of the gloves. They say that these gloves are “weatherproof” but didn’t last me an hour on the mountain
customer_reviews.author: Amber Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great and durable gloves
customer_reviews.text: I tried those while snowboarding in Greece and Switzerland. They keep my hands warm and flexible at the same time. They don't make my palms sweat. Easy to wear and take off. Work on touchscreens too while on the lift and you want to send messages, call or check maps! Snow does not get inside when I fall cause they tighten up on wrist

customer_reviews.title: Nice material, easy on and off
customer_reviews.text: My son outgrew his first pair and only wanted the same gloves in a bigger size. He likes how they feel on his hands, easy to get on and off, and can use his phone easily when wearing them. They keep his hands warm while he's snowboarding. They are well made and made with quality materials
customer_reviews.author: lavylou

customer_reviews.title: These fit great and aren't super thick
customer_reviews.text: These fit great and aren't super thick. I dislike gloves that feel like I am wearing pillows and these are a perfect combination of comfortable and warm. Definitely wouldn't ever attempt to use these with a phone, but I wouldn't expect that with any glove in existence. Maybe my hands are small, but I had to get a smaller size because I like my gloves to be very snug. I originally ordered the gloves but had to return it because the finger parts were too long.

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly made and lightweight yet warm.

Another great product from Burton.

customer_reviews.title: Meh...average

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing

customer_reviews.title: Feel great, but funnel snow and already showing wear

I don't fall often, nor put my hands down a lot, but oddly, the leather-esque material on the back of the left thumb is showing a lot of wear and tear. Very odd spot for that to be happening. At least they're still waterproof - so far. Also, they're great when you're wearing them, but if you take them off when it's snowing, the way the elastic is funnels any snow from your cuffs down into the glove.

product_meta.title: Burton Men's Insulated, Warm and Waterproof Winter Profile Glove with Touchscreen
product_meta.description:
Get more bang for your buck with midweight warmth that works all season, plus Screen Grab for ultimate touchscreen control.

Here at Burton we believe gloves and mitts should have equal rights, and are very much against glove profiling. But when a glove has a bomber-tough DRYRIDE 2L fabric, midweight Thermacore insulation, and a quick-drying and toasty fleece lining…well, you have no choice but to call a warm, weatherproof glove warm and weatherproof. It's nothing personal, but that's just what the highly versatile, bestselling Burton Profile Glove is: warm and weatherproof. Screen Grab sweetens the deal, offering easy surfing with any touchscreen device.

 * Screen Grab Toughgrip Palm for Total Touchscreen Control
 * DRYRIDE 2-Layer Fabric
 * Thermacore Insulation
 * Brushed Microfiber Fixed Lining
 * Ergonomic Pre-Curved Fit
 * Removable Wrist Leash
